main.name: Sukhbir Sekhon
main.bio: Hello! I'm Sukhbir Sekhon, and yes, go ahead and give pronouncing my name a try! My journey spans from India to the United States, where I've embraced the challenges and opportunities of a new environment. Originally drawn to Mechanical Engineering, I pivoted towards Information Technology and Software Development to explore the dynamic world of technology. As a seasoned Software Engineer III at JPMorgan Chase & Co., I bring a wealth of experience and expertise in the realm of software development. With a proven track record of delivering innovative solutions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, I thrive on the challenges and opportunities that come with designing and implementing cutting-edge software systems.
main.bio2: At JPMorgan Chase & Co., I have spearheaded the development of scalable and secure applications, ensuring compliance with industry regulations and standards. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, I translate complex business requirements into efficient and elegant software solutions, driving operational excellence and client satisfaction. Beyond my technical prowess, I am recognized for my leadership abilities, mentoring junior engineers, and fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within my team. I am committed to staying abreast of emerging technologies, attending conferences, and obtaining certifications to remain at the forefront of the ever-evolving tech landscape.
main.bio3: Driven by a desire to create a positive impact, I aim to leverage my technical acumen to tackle real-world challenges. Whether sharing knowledge with peers in academic settings or professional environments, I thrive on empowering others through education. My commitment to aiding others extends beyond boundaries, as I seek avenues to contribute to the betterment of society through technology-driven solutions. I am Sukhbir Sekhon, a forward-thinking professional poised to make a difference in the world of technology, entrepreneurship, and societal progress. Let's connect, collaborate, and create a brighter future together!
main.contactmessage: Once a wise man told me, 'You don't need a parachute to go skydiving. You need a parachute to go skydiving twice.' If you don't understand it, no worry, contact me and I will tell you the meaning.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.school: University of Cincinnati (Linder College of Business)

work.title: Software Developer | Intern
work.description: Performs mock testing extensively throughout the code. Migrated iText (Library for manipulating pdf) older version (5) to a newer version (7) library throughout the project. Lead project team of interns to create a java app to extract email data and UIPath (Robotic Process Automation) to automate the process. Created an AI process system using Azure during code jam for incoming medical records to start a claim process.

work.title: Student Worker | DevOps
work.description: Deployed web application using continuous/automation tool drone.io. Dockerized web application by building docker images and containers based on customized dockerfiles. Managed multiple Linux Suse Sle 12 web servers and monitor deployment process. Setup compatible ELK logging system for multiple web services to monitor performance of microservices. Setup servers from scratch to make it compatible for deploying web applications.
